resources.string: Released under the Creative Commons license
Arbor Familiae allows you to view your family tree using various charts and views. Trees can be imported into the app using GEDCOM files. This app does not allow editing the data.

This view shows the biographical information for the currently active individual, including information on parents, spouses and children. You can navigate through the family by clicking on the names of the family members in this view

The fan chart shows the ancestors or descendants of the active individual in a fan chart. Clicking on the centre of the chart switches between ancestor/descendant view. Long clicking on the individuals sets that individual as the root.

The heatmap shows the locations on a map for events of ancestors related to the active individual. In order for the heatmap to show locations, the places listed for the events in the imported GEDCOM need to have associated longitude and latitude coordinates.
The tree view shows the relationships of the active individual in a tree structure. Clicking on individuals sets that individual to the root of the tree.
The relationship chart calculates and displayes the relationship between the root and active individuals
Searches current tree for the matching individual based on first name, surname or suffix
The tree list view shows all currently available trees saved. From this view you can also import new trees from GEDCOM files and select an active tree

Reports allow you to generate descendant/ancestor reports. The reports can be either exported to a text file and shared with other applications, or displayed on screen. The report data is both horizontally and vertically scrollable. The available reports are: Detailed ancestry, Ancestry summary, Leaf ancestors, Descendants, mt-DNA, Y-DNA, Places, Countries, Lifespans, and Surnames.
Parsing Gedcom. This might take a while.
Could not open Android market, please install the market app.
No trees found. Please import a GEDCOM file by clicking on the + button
Generations in lines of descent chart
Number of generations to show in treechart
Number of generations to show in fanchart
Number of generations to show in heatmap
Number of generations to calculate in lines of descent
Name format to show in charts
The detailed ancestry report gives detailed biographical information for all ancestors of the active individual, up to the specified number of generations
The ancestry summary report gives a basic summary for all ancestors of the active individual, up to the specified number of generations
The leaf ancestor report gives a basic summary for all ancestors of the active individual, which are missing one or both parents, up to the specified number of generations
The descendant report shows all descendants of the active individual, up to the specified number of generations

The mt-DNA report finds the oldest ancestor with the same mt-DNA as the active individual (the maternal lineage), and then generates all descendants of this individual which share the same mt-DNA, up to the specified number of generations

The Y-DNA report finds the oldest ancestor with the same Y-DNA as the active individual (the paternal lineage), and then generates all descendants of this individual which share the same Y-DNA, up to the specified number of generations

The places report lists all places included in the life events of the ancestors, descendants of the active individual, up to the specified number of generations, or of the whole tree, including the number of occurrences of the place
The lifespan report shows a summary of the lifespans of the ancestors or descendants of the active individual, or of the whole tree, up to the specified number of generations

The countries report lists all countries included in the life events of the ancestors or descendants of the active individual, up to the specified number of generations, or of the whole tree, including the number of occurrences of the country. The report assumes that the last part of a place name, separated by commas, is the country.
The surname report lists all surnames of the ancestors or descendants of the active individual, up to the specified number of generations, or of the whole tree, including the number of occurrences.
